newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan electronics up on expected chip price rise.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan electronics up on expected chip price rise.

text.p: Shares in Taiwan's electronic firms rose sharply at mid-session on Wednesday on an improving profit outlook due to an expected price rebound for Dynamic Random Access Memory (DRAM) chips, brokers said.
With 40 minutes left, electronic shares advanced 3.87 percent compared to the overall index's rise of 2.04 percent.
"Investors expected big profits after an expected DRAM price rise, and therefore they rushed to buy electronics shares," said analyst Oliver Fang of National Securities.

Local motherboard giant Asustek Computer Inc soared by its daily seven-percent uplimit, gaining T$55 to T$846. Computer maker United Micro Electronics Corp advanced T$4 to T$66.5, and chipmaker Winbond Electronics Corp rose T$1.9 to T$48.2.
Dealers said growth in export orders and industrial output in March was also prompted by a sharp increase in foreign orders for and domestic manufacturing of electronic products.
